conclusion: The primary coil of an ideal transformer is connected to an AC power supply. The reading of the ideal ammeter is 1.4 A. The resistances on the secondary-coil side are R1=R2=R3=50Ω, and the reading of the ideal voltmeter is 10 V.

The image depicts an ideal transformer connected to an AC power source. On the primary side, there is an ammeter showing a current of 1.4 A. On the secondary side, there are three equal resistances (R1 = R2 = R3 = 50 Ω) and a voltmeter showing 10 V.

premise: The secondary side contains three equal resistances (50 Ω each).
conclusion: The equivalent resistance (R_eq) is the sum of these resistances: R_eq = R1 + R2 + R3 = 150 Ω.

premise: R_eq = 150 Ω and the given voltage is 10 V.
conclusion: The current (I_eq) on the secondary side is I_eq = V/R_eq = 0.0667 A.

conclusion: The turns ratio (n) is n = I_1/I_eq = 21.
